history.content:
I'm not clear on your question exactly but here's what I CAN say. If you received notification that you had been accepted into the major, you should not have been purged from the waitlist. Although we attempt to process the declarations before phase 1 ends, that did not occur this year due to the high number of applications that needed to be processed. There have been a few instances where people who were majors were purged in error or because something isn't tracking right in the computer system.

If you feel you have been purged in error, please email me and provide your SID number and course number so I can investigate. email: cs-scheduling@cs.berkeley.edu

children.subject: The instructor response says that if if "you received notification that you had been accepted into the major, you should not have been purged from the waitlist" so that should answer your concern.
To clarify, i think "the purge" has already happened.
Thank you both for helping me clarify!

Thank you for the response and the information. Sorry about the question. What I am concerned about is that even though I was accepted into the major and plan on having CS as my double (and have all of the paper work signed), CalCentral will not say that I am a CS major because I can't go to L&S before Phase 2 and have them process the double major.  Will this ultimately affect whether or not I will be purged?

history.content: Hello, I would just like to confirm, since I only heard by mouth, that if we submitted a double major form and recieved it signed from a CS Advisor, and we cannot go to L&S before Phase 2, that we would not be purged from the waitlist for CS upper divs. This happened after I was accepted into the major. Just wanted to confirm this so that I may start looking for other courses to replace some wait listed CS upper division courses.
history.subject: Clarification on Double Majoring and Waitlist Purge
